beginning.s: SCREAM (SCARY MOVIE) by Kevin Williamson Rewrite July 31, 1995

meta.s: A hand reaches for it, bringing the receiver up to the face of CASEY BECKER, a young girl, no more than sixteen.
A friendly face with innocent eyes.
Silence.

dialogue.name: CASEY
dialogue.s: Who are you trying to reach?

dialogue.name: CASEY
dialogue.s: What number are you trying to reach?

dialogue.name: CASEY
dialogue.s: I think you have the wrong number.

meta.s: CLICK!
She hangs up the phone.
The CAMERA PULLS BACK to reveal Casey in a living room, alone.
She moves from the living room to the kitchen.
It's a nice house.
Affluent.
The phone RINGS again.
Casey grabs the portable.

dialogue.name: MAN
dialogue.s: I guess I dialed the wrong number.

dialogue.name: CASEY
dialogue.s: So why did you dial it again?

meta.s: Casey stands in front of a sliding glass door.
It's pitch black outside.

dialogue.name: MAN
dialogue.s: I want to talk to you for a second.

meta.s: CLICK!
Casey hangs up.
A grin on her face.
A big country home with a huge sprawling lawn full of big oak trees.
It sits alone with no neighbors in sight.
The phone RINGS again.
Popcorn sizzles in a pot on the stove.
Casey covers it with a lid, reaching for the portable phone.

dialogue.name: MAN
dialogue.s: Why don't you want to talk to me?

dialogue.name: MAN
dialogue.s: You tell me your name, I'll tell you mine.

dialogue.name: CASEY
dialogue.s: (shaking the popcorn) I don't think so.

meta.s: Casey smiles, playing along, innocently.

dialogue.name: MAN
dialogue.s: I only eat popcorn at the movies.

dialogue.name: CASEY
dialogue.s: I'm getting ready to watch a video.

meta.s: He's flirting with her.
Casey moves away from the stove and takes a seat at the kitchen counter, directly in front of the glass door.

dialogue.name: MAN
dialogue.s: You have to have a favorite.

meta.s: Casey thinks for second.

dialogue.name: CASEY
dialogue.s: You know, the one with the guy with the white mask who just sorta walks around and stalks the baby sitters.

dialogue.name: MAN
dialogue.s: Is that the one where the guy had knives for fingers?

dialogue.name: CASEY
dialogue.s: The first one was, but the rest sucked.

dialogue.name: MAN
dialogue.s: You never told me your name.

meta.s: Casey smiles, twirling her hair.

dialogue.name: CASEY
dialogue.s: Why do you want to know my name?

dialogue.name: MAN
dialogue.s: Because I want to know who I'm looking at.

meta.s: Casey spins around like lightning facing the glass door.

dialogue.name: MAN
dialogue.s: I want to now who I'm talking to.

dialogue.name: MAN
dialogue.s: What do you think I said?

meta.s: Casey CLICKS on the outside light.
A flood light illuminates the backyard.
Her eyes survey the grounds.
But it's empty.
No one's there.
She turns the light out.
On the stove, the popcorn POPS.

dialogue.name: MAN
dialogue.s: Wait...I thought we were gonna go out.

meta.s: CLICK!
Casey hangs up.
She checks the glass door making sure it's locked and then moves to the stove as...
THE PHONE RINGS.
She slides the popcorn from the stove, reaching for the phone.

dialogue.name: MAN
dialogue.s: I told you not to hang up on me.

meta.s: CLICK.
She hangs up.
The phone RINGS again.
She grabs it.
NO, YOU LISTEN, YOU LITTLE BITCH.
IF YOU

dialogue.name: HANG UP ON ME AGAIN I'LL GUT YOU LIKE

meta.s: Total silence.
He has gotten her full attention.

dialogue.name: CASEY
dialogue.s: Is this some kind of a joke?

meta.s: Casey eyes the glass doors, then looks up the hallway to the front doors...moving to it.
It's unlocked.
She bolts it.

dialogue.name: CASEY
dialogue.s: I'm two seconds from calling the police.

dialogue.name: MAN
dialogue.s: They'd never make it in time.

meta.s: Casey moves her face flush against the door, her eye looking through the peephole.
ANGLE THROUGH PEEPHOLE.
A distorted view of the front porch.
It is empty.
She relaxes a bit, relieved.

dialogue.name: MAN
dialogue.s: (pure evil) TO SEE WHAT YOUR INSIDES LOOK LIKE.

meta.s: Casey's jaw drops as total fear storms her face.
She hangs up the phone, throwing it down on a side table when...
THE DOORBELL CHIMES.
Casey leaps out of her skin.
She turns to the door as it chimes again.
Another CHIME.
She moves to it.
No answer.
Fuck this.
It's time for the police.
She goes for the portable phone.
Just as she picks it up...
IT RINGS.
Casey almost drops it, losing her breath... She brings it to her ear with trembling hands, saying nothing...listening, waiting... A long silence.
And then.
Casey clutches the wall, nearly collapsing.
She tries her damndest to hang tough.

dialogue.name: CASEY
dialogue.s: You had your fun now you better leave me alone or else.

meta.s: CLOSE ON her face, her mind thinking, calculating...

dialogue.name: CASEY
dialogue.s: My boyfriend will be here any second and he'll be pissed when I tell him...

dialogue.name: MAN
dialogue.s: I thought you didn't have a boyfriend.

meta.s: Busted.
She holds steady.

dialogue.name: CASEY
dialogue.s: I do have a boyfriend and he'll be here any second and your ass better be gone.

dialogue.name: CASEY
dialogue.s: And he's big and plays football and will beat the shit out of you.

dialogue.name: MAN
dialogue.s: His name wouldn't be Steve, would it?

meta.s: Silence.
Casey buckles at the knees, losing it.

dialogue.name: CASEY
dialogue.s: How do you know his name?

dialogue.name: MAN
dialogue.s: Go to the back door and turn on the porch light--again.

meta.s: Casey, terrified, forces herself to move.. staggering to the kitchen...to the glass doors.
Her shaky hand finds the light switch...she hits it.
The back yard is lit.
Sitting in a lawn chair in the middle of the backyard is a big, line backer of a guy, her boyfriend...

dialogue.name: STEVE
dialogue.s: He's been roughed up, but he's alive.
CLOSE ON his eyes..wide in fear..staring at his girlfriend, pleading with her.

meta.s: Casey SCREAMS.
Her hand moves to the lock on the door.

dialogue.name: MAN
dialogue.s: I wouldn't do that if I were you.

meta.s: Terror rides Casey's face.
She's petrified.
Her eyes search the yard, combing bushes, trees.
He could be anywhere-anywhere.
Tears find their way, streaming down Casey's face.
A long silence.
Casey touches the glass...staring at STEVE...this big jock of a guy is crying too.
Her hand goes to the switch...Steve tugs and pulls at his straps...as if begging her...his face sweat and tears...

dialogue.name: CLICK
dialogue.s: Casey moves away from the glass, back toward the living room, unbelieving, horrified.

dialogue.name: MAN
dialogue.s: If you get it right-Steve lives.

meta.s: Three curtainless windows line one wall.
Casey crouches down behind the couch, tipping a lamp cord from it's socket, darkening the room.
Her body quivers.

dialogue.name: MAN
dialogue.s: I'll even give you a warm up question.

dialogue.name: MAN
dialogue.s: It's you favorite scary movie, remember?
He had a white mask, he stalked the baby-sitters.

meta.s: Casey goes silent...a nervous wreck...she can barely speak much less think.
Casey is SOBBING.
Casey has officially reached hysteria, petrified beyond all reality.
Suddenly...through tears...Godsent...
Casey SIGHS...relieved.
Casey is a blubbering, wet mass on the floor.

dialogue.name: MAN
dialogue.s: Name the killer in FRIDAY THE 13TH.

meta.s: A mad smile purses Casey's lips.
She knows this.
She leaps up, through tears, screaming...
A slight PAUSE.

dialogue.name: CASEY
dialogue.s: I saw that godamned movie twenty times.

dialogue.name: MAN
dialogue.s: Then you should know Jason's MOTHER -Mrs.Vorhees was the original killer.
Jason didn't show up until the sequel.

meta.s: Casey is stupefied.

dialogue.name: MAN
dialogue.s: Lucky, for you there's a bonus round.

meta.s: This implication sends Casey running to the kitchen...to the glass doors.
She flips on the porch lights to see...

dialogue.name: STEVE
dialogue.s: eyes wide, sitting in the lawn chair...his belly gaping open...a mass of blood and ripped flesh...his insides lay on the ground between his feet...steam rising.

meta.s: A SCREAM erupts from the bottom of her soul as Casey collapse on the floor...nearly passing out.
CLOSE ON her face...pale and ghostly white.
She SOBS.
She doesn't answer.
A long, maddening silence.
Casey reaches up and CLICKS off the light, making Steve go away...wishing, hoping...

dialogue.name: MAN
dialogue.s: Answer the question and I will.

meta.s: Casey is curled up on the floor like an infant, rocking slowly back and forth.

dialogue.name: MAN
dialogue.s: There are two doors to your house.
A front door and a back one.

meta.s: From where Casey sits she can see both front and back doors.
She deliberates...with her last bit of strength she tries to strategize.
Eyeing both, the front door...the back door trying to decide between the two.
In the darkness, Casey crawls to the kitchen counter-she leans up and grabs a long, sharp knife.
Casey looks around her...she looks down the hall to the front door...then turns back to the kitchen glass door as it suddenly... SHATTERS TO BITS... as a lawn chair come flying through it.
Exploding glass sprays everywhere.
This incites Casey like fire.
She springs to her feet...bolting out of the kitchen as a SHADOW moves quickly through the shattered doorframe.

dialogue.name: ANGLE ON CASEY
dialogue.s: Somewhere in the house, back flat against a window, listening to FEET ON CRACKING GLASS.
She turns and unlocks the latch, quietly sliding it up.
She can hear him move through the foyer...to the front door.

meta.s: Casey lifts herself up and puts her legs through the window.
She holds the knife in one hand, the phone in the other.
Casey eases out the window, fumbling, dropping the knife back in the house.
She starts to reach for it.
Fuck it, she takes off...
Casey it at the back corner of the house.
Casey eases along a narrow path between a tall fence and the side of the house...going for the front yard.
She must pass the three curtainless windows.
She gets to the first one and peeks in...
The FIGURE has pulled open the foyer closet, searching for her.
Casey creeps along, to the next window, she looks in...the FIGURE is completely on the other side of the room moving toward the hall that leads to other parts of the house.

She moves further along the house...squeezing by hedges...to the third window...she peeks in to the FIGURE... STARING BACK AT HER... His face covered with a ghostly white mask, inches from her...his eyes piercing through...soulless...Casey SCREAMS BLOODY MURDER as a hand... CRASHES through the glass window grabbing hold of her neck...she beats at him trying to free herself...her nails dig into his arm...she wrenches from side to side...finally breaking free as the hands disappear inside the house...
Casey sails around the corner of the house, eyeing the front door.
It remains closed.
Her eyes cover the sprawling country yard when suddenly....

dialogue.name: HEADLIGHTS APPEAR
dialogue.s: in the distance, coming down the road towards the house...she recognizes them instantly.
Mom...Dad...she tears off across the yard toward them...moving like lightning...

meta.s: The car turns into the driveway...Casey SCREAMS, waving madly, rushing by a tree as...

dialogue.name: THE GHOST MASKED FIGURE APPEARS
dialogue.s: Casey stumbles back, catching her balance...the FIGURE moves on her, arm poised high...a flash of silver...and Casey is struck, across the chest.
She looks down to see her shirt blossoming red...a look of bewilderment as she drops to one knee.

meta.s: The knife rises again...Casey throws her hand forward...the blade comes down...but it's blocked by the portable phone still in her hand.
She turns staggering to...
A MIDDLE-AGED COUPLE emerge from the parked car.
They move to the front door completely unaware of what's happening to their daughter, only feet from them.
Casey stumbles forward...her parents ten feet away...she opens her mouth to scream but no sound resonates...she is beyond words...staggering, swaying...the FIGURE moving behind her.
Her parents approach the door

dialogue.name: MOTHER
dialogue.s: I told you to send it back.

meta.s: The father discovers the front door ajar.
A puzzled look.
Casey is right behind them with one arm outstretched.
If they'd only turn around...
They enter the house and close the door as.... Casey collapses on the ground, clutching her bloody chest...the FIGURE upon her.
The father sees straight back into the kitchen...the shattered patio door.
In a split second they're both panic stricken.
The father begins searching the house frantically.
The mother is hysterical.
CLOSE ON Casey...she's dragged by her feet through damp soil...the life going fast from her body...her hand still clutching the phone.
Back in the house.
The mother moves to the phone in the foyer, picks it up...There is no dial tone.
She jiggles the base.
The...the softest...faintest voice is heard...

dialogue.name: MOTHER
dialogue.s: She's here, God, I can hear her.

meta.s: The husband returns to the foyer finding his wife clinging to the phone.

dialogue.name: MOTHER
dialogue.s: Oh Mother of God, I can hear her.

meta.s: The father upturns the living room.
The husband grabs hold of his wife.

dialogue.name: FATHER
dialogue.s: Get in the car and drive down to the Mackenzie's.

meta.s: The other throws the front door open and rushes out...the father moves through the house when a SCREAM echoes out.
That of his wife.
He tears off for the front door.
The father rushes out the door to find his wife, on her knees, bent over, retching.
His eyes move beyond to a tree in the front yard...his stomach fails him...his dinner rises...as he bares witness to the single, most horrifying sight he'll ever see.
That of his only daughter as she hangs from a big oak tree...strung up...very much dead...her stomach ripped open.
BLACKOUT!
BEGIN MAIN TITLES
A teenage girl's room.
Neat and pinkish.
On the bed, amongst age- old stuffed animals lie opened school books.
The CAMERA PANS to a desk against the wall where...

dialogue.name: SIDNEY PRESCOTT
dialogue.s: a young girl of 17, sits, her face glued to the computer monitor in front of her.
Sharp and clever with deep, lonely eyes.
She's comfortable in a plain, flannel nightgown.

meta.s: Her hands are at work, typing feverishly, when suddenly...

dialogue.name: CRASH-BOOM
dialogue.s: She turns abruptly, eyeing an open window across the room.
She stands and moves toward it.

meta.s: Sidney sticks her head out the window.
The late night wind hits her face as a SHADOW appears just to the left of her, a hand reaches out, grabs her and suddenly a FIGURE is on top of her...
Sid SCREAMS...pulling away from the figure...breaking free, falling back onto the floor.
Sid looks up to see...

dialogue.name: BILLY LOOMIS
dialogue.s: A young, strapping boy of seventeen.
A star quarterback/ class president type of guy.
He sports a smile that could last for days.

meta.s: Billy pulls himself through the window.

dialogue.name: SIDNEY
dialogue.s: (whispering) My dad's in the other room.

meta.s: Suddenly...
The bedroom door BURSTS open.
The doorknob catches on the open closet door behind it jamming it, holding it in place.

dialogue.name: VOICE
dialogue.s: (from behind door) What's going on in there?

meta.s: Billy quickly rolls out of sight behind the bed.
Sidney unjams the door to reveal... MR. PRESCOTT, late 40's, a severe presence.
A distracted man, nervous and pre-occupied.

dialogue.name: MR. PRESCOTT
dialogue.s: My flight leaves first thing in the morning.
Now the expo runs all weekend so I won't be back til Sunday.
There's cash on the table and I'll be staying at the Raleigh Hilton...

meta.s: He gives the bedroom a quick once over.

dialogue.name: MR. PRESCOTT
dialogue.s: I coulda swore I heard screaming.

meta.s: Sidney distracts him, giving him a peck on the cheek.
He gives her a wink and pulls the door closed.
Billy reappears.
Billy takes a flying leap and lands on the bed.

dialogue.name: BILLY
dialogue.s: It just occurred to me that I've never snuck through your bedroom window.

dialogue.name: SIDNEY
dialogue.s: Now that it's out of your system.

dialogue.name: BILLY
dialogue.s: And I was home, bored, watching television, THE EXORCIST was on and it got me thinking of you.

dialogue.name: BILLY
dialogue.s: Yeah, it was edited for TV.
All the good stuff was cut out and I started thinking about us and how two years ago, we started off kinda hot and heavy, a nice solid "R" rating on our way to an NC17.
And how things have changed and, lately, we're just sot of...edited for television.

dialogue.name: SIDNEY
dialogue.s: So you thought you could sneak in my window and we would have little bump- bump.

dialogue.name: BILLY
dialogue.s: I wouldn't dream of breaking your underwear rule.
I just thought we might do some on top of the clothes stuff.

meta.s: She snuggles up next to him, planting a kiss on his lips.
Passionate and gentle.
He, however, reacts like a shark, moving on top of her, his hands everywhere as he presses into her...Sidney breaks away.
Billy sits up.
His heart isn't racing...it's POUNDING.

dialogue.name: BILLY
dialogue.s: See what you do to me.

meta.s: Sweat has popped out all over his forehead, his breathing heavy.

dialogue.name: SIDNEY
dialogue.s: You know what my dad will do to you?

meta.s: He moves to the window.
She follows, motioning to his wound.
She gives him a kiss goodnight.
Sweet and simple.

dialogue.name: BILLY
dialogue.s: I'm not trying to rush you.

meta.s: She kisses him again as he eases through the window.

dialogue.name: SIDNEY
dialogue.s: Would you settle for a PG-13 relationship?

meta.s: She pulls her flannel gown open for a split second...flashing her left breast.
His mouth drops open...surprise, shock.
Their eyes meet.
They share a smile.
CLOSE on Sidney snuggling her pillow, sleeping peacefully when...
THE RADIO ALARM BLASTS from the night table loud enough to wake the dead.
Sidney bolts up.
CLICK.
Sidney, quick with the reflexes, shuts it off instantly.
A car trunk SLAMS shut outside.
Sidney pulls herself out of bed and leans to the window just in time to see her Dad jumping in his car.
She half waves down at him but he doesn't see her.
He's as good as gone, pulling out of the driveway and disappearing down the road.
A moment as Sidney stands at the window, staring out after him.
THE CAMERA PULLS BACK TO REVEAL a picture perfect small town school.
Old and charming.
Students come and go, moving about.
Nothing unusual, except for the... six police cars, four news vans, flashing cameras, and crowds and crowds of lookie-loo's gathered just off campus.
Sidney approaches the school seeing the commotion.
Four different REPORTERS stand in front of four different cameras giving four different news reports.
She moves passed a policeman standing guard.
Her interest peaked, she stops at the first reporter who is...

dialogue.name: GALE WEATHERS
dialogue.s: He smart face is overshadowed by a flashy smile and a massive mane of chemically enhanced hair.

dialogue.name: GALE
dialogue.s: (for the camera) The small town of Bayboro, North Carolina was devastated last night when two young teenagers were found brutally butchered.
Authorities have yet to issue a statement but our sources tell us that no arrest has been made and the murderer could strike again...

meta.s: ON SIDNEY.
Moved, disturbed.
From behind, a finger taps her shoulder.
She spins around to see... Tatum Riley, same age, feisty, carefree.
They break away from the crowd and head for school.

dialogue.name: TATUM
dialogue.s: Casey Becker and Steve Forrest were killed last night.

dialogue.name: TATUM
dialogue.s: We're talking splatter movie killed-split open end to end.

dialogue.name: SIDNEY
dialogue.s: She sits next to me in English.

dialogue.name: TATUM
dialogue.s: Her parents found her hanging from a tree.

dialogue.name: SIDNEY
dialogue.s: Do they know who did it?

dialogue.name: TATUM
dialogue.s: Fucking clueless-they're interrogating the entire school.

dialogue.name: TATUM
dialogue.s: Dewey said this is the worst crime they've ever seen.
Even worse than... (stopping herself) Well it's bad.

meta.s: Sidney looks back at Gale, her face deeply pained.
A frumpy old woman, MRS. TATE, faces her class.
Her hands clasped together.
A tragic look upon her face.

dialogue.name: MRS. TATE
dialogue.s: It's days like today we need prayer in school...

meta.s: Sidney sits near the rear of the room.
The desk in front of her sits vacant.
Sidney can't take her eyes of it.
The door opens and a student opens with a slip of paper.
He hand s it to Mrs. Tate.

dialogue.name: MRS. TATE
dialogue.s: It appears to be your turn.

meta.s: The room is at capacity...wall to wall with police, and the likes.
Some sit, stand, lean... SHERIFF BURKE, a round man in his fifties, wipes the stress from his face.
A young officer looks at the clipboard.
This is DEPUTY RILEY, better known as DEWEY.
He's a big guy, 20's, handsome in a scrubbed-clean boyish way.
Sheriff Burke gestures to bring her in.
PRINCIPAL HIMBRY, 50's, an old codger of a man wearing a sour face speaks up.

dialogue.name: DEWEY
dialogue.s: We all know Sidney, Mr. Himbry.

meta.s: Himbry stops short, seeing Sidney in the doorway.
He rises and seats her.
Dewey shakes his head seriously.

dialogue.name: MR. HIMBRY
dialogue.s: The police have a few questions they'd like to ask you...

meta.s: Sidney eyes them all nervously.
Students sit at outdoor tables eating lunch.
Crowded at one table is the "gang".
This consists of Sidney, Billy and Tatum.
Next to Tatum, sits her boyfriend STUART, with his arm draped across her back.
He's a Billy wannabe.
Almost the jock, almost handsome, almost cool.
He tries way to hard.
Across the table is the fifth wheel, RANDY.
A tall and gangly kid with no such Billy-like aspirations.
A witty jokester who elevates geek to coolness.

dialogue.name: TATUM
dialogue.s: Why would they ask if you like to hunt?

dialogue.name: STU
dialogue.s: I don't know, they just did.

meta.s: Sidney flinches.

dialogue.name: TATUM
dialogue.s: They didn't ask me if I like to hunt.

dialogue.name: STU
dialogue.s: Because there's no way a girl could have killed them.

dialogue.name: TATUM
dialogue.s: The killer could easily be female-BASIC INSTINCT.

dialogue.name: RANDY
dialogue.s: That was an ice pick-not exactly the same.

dialogue.name: STU
dialogue.s: Yeah, Casey and Steve were completely hollowed out.
Takes a man to do something like that.

dialogue.name: SIDNEY
dialogue.s: (quiet, almost to herself) How do you gut someone?

meta.s: All eyes turn to Sidney.
A serious silence.
And then:

dialogue.name: STU
dialogue.s: You take a knife and slit from the groin to the sternum.

meta.s: Sidney shivers down to her soul.
The whole table rolls their eyes at Stu.

dialogue.name: RANDY
dialogue.s: Remember in JAWS when they caught the wrong shark at first and Richard Dreyfuss cut it open to look foe body parts and all they found was a licence plate and all this white milky goo.

meta.s: Stu leans over and socks Randy in the arm.

dialogue.name: STU
dialogue.s: You heard Billy-shut the fuck up.

dialogue.name: SIDNEY
dialogue.s: Didn't you use to date Casey?

meta.s: Stu's taken back, a little off guard.

dialogue.name: RANDY
dialogue.s: Before she dumped him foe Steve.

meta.s: Tatum turns to Stu, surprised.

dialogue.name: TATUM
dialogue.s: I thought you dumped her for me.

dialogue.name: RANDY
dialogue.s: And are the police aware you dated the victim?

dialogue.name: STU
dialogue.s: That I killed her or something?

dialogue.name: RANDY
dialogue.s: It would certainly improve your high school Q.

dialogue.name: TATUM
dialogue.s: Stu was with me last night.

dialogue.name: RANDY
dialogue.s: Oooooh...before or after he sliced and diced.

dialogue.name: RANDY
dialogue.s: Besides- (perfect Stu mimic) "Takes a man to do something like that."

dialogue.name: STU
dialogue.s: I'm gonna gut your ass in a second.

dialogue.name: RANDY
dialogue.s: (to Stu) Did you really put her liver in the mailbox?
I hear they found her liver in the mailbox.

dialogue.name: TATUM
dialogue.s: (eyeing Sidney) Randy, you goon-fuck, I'm eating here.

meta.s: Stu nibbles at Tatum's neck.

dialogue.name: STU
dialogue.s: I think you better liver alone.

meta.s: Stu cracks up at his own joke.
The others just MOAN.
Sidney is about to crawl out of her skin, trying hard to ignore it all.
A huge two story country home with a spacious lawn.
A yellow school bus stops in front of the house and Sidney steps off.
The house looks big and lonely as Sidney moves up the walk to the front door.
Sidney is on the telephone.

dialogue.name: SIDNEY
dialogue.s: (into phone) You sure I can stay over?
My dad won't be back til Sunday.

dialogue.name: TATUM
dialogue.s: I'll pick you up after practice.

dialogue.name: SIDNEY
dialogue.s: Tell your mom I said thanks.

dialogue.name: SIDNEY
dialogue.s: Uh-huh, it's just...you know, the police and reporters...it brings it all back.

meta.s: Sidney hangs up.
She takes a seat at her computer and boots it up.
She sits in front of it staring at the blue screen...her own reflection staring back.
Sidney comes down the stairs, her arms carrying a change of clothes, toothbrush, make-up... She opens the hall closet and pulls a small overnight bag from the top shelf.
Moving into the living room she loads it up, plopping down on the sofa, hitting the TV remote.

dialogue.name: REPORTER #1
dialogue.s: (on TV) The entire nation was shocked today by the teen murders in North Carolina...

meta.s: Sidney switches channels.

dialogue.name: REPORTER #2
dialogue.s: The State Bureau of Investigation has joined forces with local authorities to help catch what the Governor has called the most heinous...

meta.s: The channel switches again.
Gale weathers appears, standing in front of the school.
Her white teeth gleaming.

dialogue.name: GALE
dialogue.s: This is not the first time the small town of Bayboro has endured such tragedy.
Only a year ago, Maureen Prescott, wife and mother, was found raped and murdered...

meta.s: An old black and white snapshot fills the screen-a woman, beautiful and familiar.

dialogue.name: CLOSE ON SIDNEY
dialogue.s: eyes frozen, mesmerized by the image.
Suddenly she CLICKS the TV off.
Her eyes go to the clock on the end table.
Her eyes then move to the framed photo next to it...the same black and white photo stares at her...a healthy, vibrant woman.
